info.title: Anchor Platform
info.description: The Anchor Platform is a set of tools and APIs that enable developers and businesses to build their own on and off-ramp services for the Stellar network. It provides a standardized interface, including the implementation of several Stellar Ecosystem Proposals (SEPs), to make it easy for businesses to integrate with Stellar-based wallets and exchanges.

servers.name: Platform API
servers.summary: Example URL endpoint for the Platform Server.
servers.description: Example URL endpoint for the Platform Server. Note: This is an example URL only, you must configure your own Platform Server.

customers.description:
The Identification info of the sending and receiving customers. If they were created through [SEP-12](https://stellar.org/protocol/sep-12),
            this object should contain the SEP-12 customer `id`. Otherwise, the `account` address of the customer.

sender.description:
A object that identify end-user. 
For a SEP-12 customer, the `id` field should be sufficient to fully identify the customer in the business' Backend. 
For a SEP-31 Sending Anchor, the `account` and `memo` fields should be used. 
For a SEP-6 or SEP-24 Anchor, the `account` and `memo` fields should be used.

id.description: The `id` of the customer registered through SEP-12.

account.description: Either the Stellar account or Muxed account address of the on-chain entity.

memo.description: The memo value identifying a customer with a shared account, where the shared account is `account`.

receiver.description:
A object that identify end-user. 
For a SEP-12 customer, the `id` field should be sufficient to fully identify the customer in the business' Backend. 
For a SEP-31 Sending Anchor, the `account` and `memo` fields should be used. 
For a SEP-6 or SEP-24 Anchor, the `account` and `memo` fields should be used.

id.description: The `id` of the customer registered through SEP-12.

account.description: Either the Stellar account or Muxed account address of the on-chain entity.

memo.description: The memo value identifying a customer with a shared account, where the shared account is `account`.

creator.description:
A object that identify end-user. 
For a SEP-12 customer, the `id` field should be sufficient to fully identify the customer in the business' Backend. 
For a SEP-31 Sending Anchor, the `account` and `memo` fields should be used. 
For a SEP-6 or SEP-24 Anchor, the `account` and `memo` fields should be used.

id.description: The `id` of the customer registered through SEP-12.

account.description: Either the Stellar account or Muxed account address of the on-chain entity.

memo.description: The memo value identifying a customer with a shared account, where the shared account is `account`.

value.message: Please don't forget to foo bar

methods.name: get_transactions
methods.description: Query a list of transactions by SEP, transaction status or other criteria.

params.name: sep
params.description: Sep of the transaction belongs to

params.name: order_by
params.summary: The field that transactions will be ordered by .
params.description: Specifies field that transactions will be ordered by. Note, that secondary sort is transaction id in ascending value.

schema.title: order_by
schema.description: The order by string used to sort the results.

params.name: statuses
params.description: The statuses of the transaction to filter by.

schema.title: status
schema.description: The statuses of the transaction to filter by.

params.name: page_size
params.summary: The number of transactions to return.
params.description: The number of records to return in each page.

schema.title: page_size
schema.description: The number of records to return in each page.

params.name: page_number
params.summary: The page number of transactions to return.
params.description: Page number to use for continuous search. Page count beings at 0.

schema.title: page_number
schema.description: Page number to use for continuous search. Page count beings at 0.

methods.name: notify_customer_info_updated
methods.description: The customer's status for the transaction has been updated. Use this method to notify the wallet of the status change. If `customer_id` and `customer_type` are provided, the transaction status will reflect the customer's status. If not, the transaction status will default to the standard pending status for the SEP.

methods.name: notify_onchain_funds_received
methods.description: Notify that the payment is being processed internally by anchor for SEP-6 or SEP-24. For SEP-31, notify that the payment is being processed by the Receiving Anchor. In the request, amount parameters are optional, but have a strict rule of how to set them. Either none, only `amount_in`, or all of fields (`amount_in`, `amount_out`, `fee_details`) must be specified.
